intro: Gynoxys jelskii, commonly known as the Mexican flameflower, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America, characterized by its bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Gynoxys jelskii is also valued for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
